title: Srimad Bhagavad-gita - Chapter 6 Recitation | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | ISKCON Bangalore Sanga
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.summary: The initial verses of Chapter 6 are recited, focusing on the principles of yoga, self-control, and detachment from material desires as paths to spiritual elevation.
segments.transcript: Bhagavad Gita Chapter 6 Sankhya Yoga Sankalpa Yogī Bhavati Kaścana Ārurukṣor Muneryogam Kalmakāraṇa Mucyate Yogārūḍhasya Tasyaivā Shamaḥ Kāraṇa Mucyate Yadāyīn Vrīyārthēśu Nagarmasvanu Śajyate Sarva Sankalpa Sanyāsī Yogārūḍhasya Dōchyate Uddhare Rākma Nākmānam Nākmānam Avasādaye Ātmaivahyātmano Vandhur Ātmaivaripur Ātmanah Vandhur Ātmātmanas Tasyaiyēn Ātmaivātmanā Jitah Anātmanas Tuśatrutve Vartey Ātmaivaśatruvat Jitātmanaf Prāśāntasya Paramātmā Samāhitah Śrī Tōṣṇasuka Dukkheśu Tathā Mānāpamānai Oho Jñāna-Vijñāna-Triptātmā Pūtas-Dhōvici-Tendriyaha Yutta-Ittyuccate Yogī-Samalośkāśma-Kāñcanahā Sūraṇ-Mitrāryu-Dāsīnā-Madhyas-Tadveśya-Vandhuśu Sāduśvapicha-Pāpeśu-Samabuddhir-Viśiśyate

segments.summary: Verses describing the process of meditation, proper posture, and controlling the mind to achieve peace and attain the supreme destination are recited.
segments.transcript: Yogī-Yunjīta-Satatam-Ātmānam-Raha-Sisthitahā Ekākīyata-Chittātmā-Nirāśīra-Parigrāhā Śrucho-Deśe-Pratiṣṭhāpyā-Sthiramāsanam Ātmanahā Nātyu-Chṛtaṁ nāti-Nīcaṁ cailājina-Kuśottaraṁ Tatraikā-Grahmāna-Kṛtvāyata-Chittyendriyā-Kriyahā Upavishyā-Sane-Yunjyā-Yoga-Mātmāmi-Shuddhaye Samamkāya-Śiro-Grīvam-Dhāra-Yanna-Chalam-Sthirahā Sampreksha-Nāsikā-Grahm-Svam-Dhi-Shacchāna-Valokayantā Prāśāntātmā-Vigatabhir-Brahma-Chārī-Vateṣṭhitahā Manas-Samyam-Yamacchitta-Yukta-Āsītam-Atparahā Yunjan-Evam-Sadātmānam-Yogī-Niyata-Mānasahā Shāntim-Nirvāṇa-Paramā-Matsam-Sthāma-Dhigacchati

segments.summary: The recitation emphasizes the importance of moderation in eating, sleeping, and activities, highlighting how yoga can alleviate suffering and lead to transcendental happiness.
The verses discuss the process of detaching from desires, controlling the mind, and seeing all beings with equality, leading to the highest perfection in yoga.
Arjuna expresses doubt about controlling the restless mind, and Krishna explains the importance of practice and detachment, assuring that one who strives for self-realization never faces degradation.
segments.transcript: Arjuna-Vāchā-Yoyam-Yogas-Tvayā-Protas-Sāmyena-Madhusūdhā Tasyā-Hamna-Paśyāmi-Chancha-Latvāsthitimsthirā Chancha-Lamhimana-Kṛṣṇa-Pramāthi-Valabhadraṭham Tasyā-Hamnigraham-Manyevāyo-Rivasudhuṣkaram Śrī-Bhagavān-Vāchā-Asamśayam-Mahā-Bhāho-Manodur-Nigraham-Chalam Abhyā-Seṇa-Tukaunteya-Vairāgyena-Vairāgyena Cangriyate-Asamyatātmanā-Yogodush-Prāpa-Itimemati Vaśyātmanā-Tuyatatā-Śakyo-Vābtu-Muvāyatah Arjuna-Vāchā-Ayati-Śraddha-Yopeto-Yogā-Chalita-Mānasah Aprāpya-Yogasam-Siddhin-Kāṅgatin-Kṛṣṇa-Gacchati Kacchinnō-Haya-Vibhraṣṭhas-Chinnā-Brahmi-Vanasaḥ A Śyatī-Apratiṣṭho-Mahābhāho-Vimūḍho-Brahmaṇa-Affati Etanne-Samśayam-Kṛṣṇa-Chetru-Marhasya-Shaśataha Tvaraṇya-Samśayas-Yāśyā-Chetā-Nahyupapadyate Śrī-Bhagavān-Vāchā-Pārtha-Nai-Veha-Nāmuttra- Vināśa-Stasyavidyate Na hi Kalyān-Kratkaścid-Durgate Na hi Kalyān-Kratkaścid-Durgate Na hi Kalyān-Kratkaścid-Durgate
